visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly sales performance across four product categories using categorical comparison. Requirements: Dark blue axis labels (12px), custom color scheme, white background, bottom legend positioning, and synthetic sales data spanning four months with realistic variance.
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains four categorical variables (products) with quantitative sales metrics across four temporal intervals. Synthetic data follows normal distributions (μ=12,500-16,100, σ≈1,500) with intentional patterns: Product A shows steady growth (+29% YTD), Product C demonstrates March surge (+70% MoM), while Product D exhibits moderate seasonality. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining categorical separation. Color choices follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles with high contrast between series. Temporal progression is reinforced through left-right spatial encoding, and value quantification uses direct label positioning to minimize eye scanning.
